history.content:
70 has no practical correlation with 61C, so you can take them in either order (or, as many people do, take them together). 

61C does build off some programming understandings from 61B, but there is no need per se to take it immediately after 61B. That being said, the 61-series was designed educationally to give you different perspectives of programming, so it may help you appreciate 61C from a pedagogical view if you take it while 61B is fresh in your mind.

Keep in mind that 61C and 70 are "gateways" to the upper-division classes; almost every upper division I can think of has one of these two as pre-requisites, so it is a good idea to take them as soon as you can (possibly together, although the workload will be heavy) so you can begin exploring the upper divisions.

Hi,

I am tentatively deciding on a course schedule for the fall and was wondering whether I can take CS70 during the fall and 61c during spring next year.

Is it advisable to take all of the 61 series first and then do 70 or can you do 70 before 61c? Would postponing 61c until spring semester affect my understanding of it (i.e., would I be in a better position if I take 61c as soon as I am done with A and B?)
history.subject: CS70 before 61C?
